name: ORSaline N 20pes
keywords: ORSaline N 20pes, smc-plus
description:
• Product Type: Orsaline-N
  • Brand: SMC
  • Oral Rehydration salt
  • WHO & UNICEF approved a new formula
  • Contains 1.30 gm Sodium Chloride; 0.75 gm, Potassium Chloride; 1.45 gm Tri-Sodium Citrate, Di-hydrate; 6.75 gm Glucose, Anhydrous. 
  • ORSaline-N the flagship brand from SMC is one of the most trusted brands in Bangladesh. It saves millions of lives every year. SMC pioneered and launched ORSaline in the year 1985 when the death toll from diarrhea was rapidly growing among children. It was re-introduced with the brand name ORSaline-N with the new formula recommended by WHO and UNICEF in 2004.
  • SMC’s ORSaline-N is the number one choice in diarrhea and dehydration management and is the trusted brand available in every corner of Bangladesh. The market for ORS is being driven by growth in two areas: treatment of dehydration caused by diarrhea and dehydration caused by excessive sweating.

name: Femicon Oral Contraceptive Pill-Femicon
keywords: Femicon Oral Contraceptive Pill-Femicon , femicon
description:
Oral contraceptives are prescribed to prevent pregnancy in women who choose to take them as a method of contraception.
Oral contraceptives have a high success rate. Except for sterilization
the IUD, and implants, the efficiency of these contraceptive techniques is determined by how well they are utilized.
Lower failure rates can be achieved by using methods correctly and consistently.

name: Norix Emergency Contraceptive Pill- Norix
keywords: Norix Emergency Contraceptive Pill- Norix, norix
description:
• Norix is an emergency contraceptive for woman. Norix should be used with in 72 hours of unprotected intercourse. It should not be taken as regular birth control pill. This medicine is also known as post coital pill and morning after pill.
  • Norix tablet contains 1.5 mg levonorgestrel belongs to a group of medicines called progestogen.
  • Each pack of Norix contains 2 round white tablet.
  • Do not take it before consulting with your doctor
